newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH APRIL CPI BELOW 15.5 PCT VS MARCH 16.6 PCT.
newsitem.headline: POLISH APRIL CPI BELOW 15.5 PCT VS MARCH 16.6 PCT.

text.p: Polish year-on-year inflation slowed to below 15.5 percent in April from 16.6 percent in March and is likely to fall even lower than the 13-percent target at year-end, Finance Minister Marek Belka said.

"Inflation at the end of April was less than 15.5 percent and at the end of the year it may be even lower than the 13 percent forecast," PAP news agency quoted Belka as saying late on Wednesday at a meeting with businessmen.
PAP reported Belka as saying Poland's current account gap was so far very well bridged by foreign capital inflows.
Polish current account deficit is expected to rise to 3-3.5 percent of the gross domestic product this year against one percent last year.
